sense.name: officially register something, as a document or claim
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] FILE NP2[patient] NP1[agent] FILE (PP{P NP})
sense.examples: Tom and Mary have filed for divorce. They are not going to file charges against the tire manufacturer. We filed our taxes early this year. The neighbors filed a complaint about the loud parties next door.

sense.name: smooth a surface with an instrument
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] FILE NP2[patient] (PP{P NP[instrument]})
sense.examples: Sally filed her fingernails with an emory board. He filed the edges smooth on the metal bar.

sense.name: proceed in a line
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[topic] FILE PP NP1[topic] FILE ADVP Note: intransitive usage Includes: FILE IN, FILE OUT
sense.examples: The protesters filed peacefully down Main Street. The parents watched their children file in wearing costumes. The ballet troupe filed out, each one bowing as they exited the stage.

sense.name: place or store according to a systematic scheme
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] FILE NP2[patient] (PP) Note: What is filed is usually paperwork, but could be a hobbyist's collection, mental representation, etc. Includes: FILE AWAY
sense.examples: File these papers. I need a new folder to file these bills. File these specimens in the second drawer. John files away the theater bills from every Broadway show.
